docs.title: Services
docs.text:
Hazenberg IT is providing B2B services

  • Software implementation projects: A-Z implementation projects, from high/low-level design to implementation, to ops. Greenfield, Brownfield, migrations, etc.
  • Customer success: to act as a link between customer and product/service team, consulting, coordination
  • DevOps: Development services in languages such as Scala, Python, or Golang. Focussed on backend, using common practices like IaC and/or GitOps.
  • Automation services: Automate deployments and release pipelines, Kubernetes, hosting -- linux based
  • Consultancy: identify problems, identify solutions, feedback, etc.
  • Training: knowledge sharing is part of any project, to develop content or provide training.

Feel free to contact us.

docs.title: 2021 July - 2024 December -- Kamer van Koophandel, Utrecht, NL
docs.text:
Implementation consultant, 99% remote.

Implementation of StackState Observability Platform for KVK's Cyber Security Services department. As of 2024, StackState is part of SUSE -- SUSE Observability.

Use cases: observability in the IT landscape, monitoring, insight into running IT infrastructure and its metadata to identify security weaknesses

  • Brought StackState v6 to production
  • Brought StackState v5 to production
  • Deployed StackState v5 and v6 in non-production and production environments
  • Integrated with non-production and production environments;
    • Kubernetes
    • VMWare vSphere
    • Zabbix
    • XL Deploy
    • Prometheus
    • static topology source
    • Elastic Observability
    • SolarWinds
    • MSSQL databases
  • Written and/or extended functionality for integrations using Python
    • XL Deploy
    • SolarWinds (Server & Application Monitor)
    • MSSQL (via ODBC)
    • Prometheus
  • Supported team in creating the Elastic Observability integration
  • Written user manuals, service descriptions, low-level design and keeping these up-to-date
  • Written and managed RFC's
  • Executed the road to production
  • Managed RBAC roles and AD-groups
  • Debugged and solved issues
  • Configured Single Sign-on using OIDC and Azure Active Directory
  • Deployment and bootstrapping via Gitlab CI/CD pipelines only to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
  • Upgraded StackState from v5 to v6, using Helm charts
  • Upgraded StackSTate from v4 to v5, from Linux to Kubernetes
  • Rancher
  • Scrum / Jira
  • One StackState Agent Deployment per integration, deployed in AKS
  • Build StackState Agent Docker container for KVK based on StackState's upstream Docker container
  • Build separate StackState Agent Docker container to include ODBC libraries (msodbcsql18 & pyODBC) for MSSQL based integrations
  • Used Kustomize to manage the StackState Agent Deployment
  • Handled secrets in the StackState Agent Docker container using Azure Key Vault
  • Used Hashcorp Vault for deployments
  • Detecting and handling CVE's
  • Datadog Agent
  • Configured backup/restore for StackState v5 using minio and Azure Blob Storage
  • Deployment of StackState v4 on CentOs Ubuntu VMs
  • Configured backup/restore using bash and cron for StackState v4.
  • Periodically tested the restore prodecure.
  • Configured nginx to terminate TLS for StackState v4, Ingress controller for v5 & v6
